tweets.text:
Heavy & persistent rainfall has led to widespread surface water & river #flooding in parts of the #Midlands 

Our teams are out on the ground clearing grills & screens, erecting temporary flood barriers & operating flood defences ‚ÄØ

Keep-up-to date ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/YYnH5wHr0z

A huge thank you to the @EnvAgencyMids team, one of which was out with me last night in the pouring rain checking on pumping equipment by the river and this morning the same person was out in waders digging out twigs, branches and a wheelie bin from the beck. #dediction üéÑüëèüèª

Following the extensive river flooding in Buckingham & surrounding villages last night, we‚Äôre on site and continuing to work with our partners ‚Äì including the @EnvAgencySE, @Bucksfire, @BuckinghamTC, town and parish councils and Bucks and Oxon 4x4 Rescue Group (BORG)... https://t.co/212j2tt48m

urls.title: Report a flood or possible cause of flooding
urls.description: Report a cause of flooding: who to contact for burst water mains, flooded sewers, public drains, roads, rivers

tweets.text: Quick check in with the @EnvAgencyYNE  Duty team covering the North & East of #Yorkshire. We continue to work remotely to #monitor river levels. Thinking of @EnvAgency colleagues in other regions who are managing #incidents at this time To report flooding: https://t.co/POmrTsFH0j https://t.co/Th0ozyQ4kn

tweets.text: This is a great example of valley fan rejuvenation and all achieved with minimal effort. These perennial distributaries will transform the valley side. Well done @WildHaweswater @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/sAQCBgNbN6

One day to go until the big #ChristmasDinner 

#DidYouKnow pouring fats, oils & grease down the sink can lead to a build up of fatbergs, causing blockages & pollution!
 
Cool leftover cooking fats before scraping them into the food waste or bin. 

Don‚Äôt feed a festive #fatberg https://t.co/9w663VK7KR

tweets.text: We are looking at an improving picture in Somerset. All our spillways, except Athelney, are expected to continue running for the rest of the day.  When river levels allow, pump stations will automatically resume. Meanwhile in Northmoor, extra pumps are working to lower levels. https://t.co/ObT01eTrNc

@martynbolt @EnvAgencyYNE Hi Martyn, information about the charity's accounts is all publicly available on our website in our annual accounts: https://t.co/DIeZaxjUsx. This will answer your questions. Best wishes

When cooking #ChristmasDinner, don‚Äôt pour fats, oils, grease and scraps down the sink as this can lead to a build-up of #fatbergs, causing blockages and pollution. 

Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 

Don‚Äôt feed a festive fatberg. https://t.co/mJx5p2fM9H

tweets.text: @NorthamptonBC @EnvAgency @LockTask nervous this evening as we see the floodplain on Banbury Lane fill up. It‚Äôs looking much more full than I‚Äôve seen in 5 years and I worry the traveller fly tipping in the field will be gone by morning....into Wootton brook.

@kateneeeedham @WYSIW @frances_cutler @MyDoncaster @DonnyGreenParty @Arcadia_For_All @YHGreenParty @KirkleesTrees @alisonclareteal @fee0na @ZFbpe Network rail have felled 2 million trees in the last few years in England. In 2017 they came and felled the trackside trees near my house. It was devastating for the local animals and birds. It was done in May so it nesting season. Network rail seem to be above the law.

Planning to spend time in or near a river this Christmas? Fishing, canoeing or walking?

Remember to #CheckCleanDry your footwear and equipment to help prevent the spread of invasive diseases

https://t.co/CaopPwbarM https://t.co/NeWvOM5u40

tweets.text:
Heavy rain from overnight could cause in flooding in parts of the Midlands, Lincolnshire and East Anglia today (Thursday). 

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.

Sign up to get warnings in England: https://t.co/60gMJ48T7b https://t.co/rj8WQhHFrY
@MariaHerlihyEA @MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @WomenInFCERM How long for?

Lots of reports of Internal Drainage Boards & @EnvAgency staff working hard at the moment to deal with yet more heavy rainfalls events. The vital work of @ADA_updates members is of critical importance to so many communities across the Country https://t.co/4oNVMyASvC

Number of @EnvAgency  #flood warnings increasing as this current rainfall lands on saturated ground. Stay flood aware and avoid walking or driving through #flood water ... stay safe. For more info go to https://t.co/GZODjmtRpO https://t.co/sSMtuyGCKW

Everyone from #TeamEA would like to wish our followers all the very best for over the festive season.

Our account will continue to be active over the holidays, but remember to report any environmental incidents to us on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/aGmYHRjF9I

Great video from the @CoalAuthority & the @EnvAgency about their great work on old metal mines to remove polluting metals from rivers.

https://t.co/xdQV282TV7

It nicely demonstrates the importance of holding all industries accountable for restoration

@The_RRC @EAGeomorphology

North East households are being urged not to become accidental waste criminals this Christmas, and to use licensed waste removal operators find out more https://t.co/zxdE4EBny9 https://t.co/L4RVUeTjLy

tweets.text: Mixed emotions this morning. V lucky to have a #XmasEve the family. While sadly many 100‚Äôs of people in @EnvAgency, local councils, int drainage boards & emergency services responding today. Best wishes to all & anyone impacted. #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/5Pu34jr2NO

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK And now the @EnvAgency will have to start properly regulating the water industry, at least on that stretch of the River Wharfe.

That too will be a first.

@MTWnhs @MTWEmergDept @mtweprr @kent_police @kentfirerescue @RNLI @SECAmbulance @SERVKent @HMCoastguard @KentHighways @EnvAgencySE @UKPowerNetworks @SouthernWater @sewateruk @BritishArmy @RoyalNavy @RoyalAirForce @RoyalMarines @airambulancekss https://t.co/SjrxfgSwA5

tweets.text:
Anglers with a current valid fishing licence can register for a FREE one-day @EnvAgency #fishing licence worth ¬£6 ‚Äì ¬£12 to take a friend, family member or colleague fishing between the 19th December to 10th January (inclusive).

#TakeaFriendFishing üëâ https://t.co/zRn8nGuPOc https://t.co/Y1wGvEDIyf

A number of roads remain closed in #Gloucestershire this morning (24/12) after yesterday's rain led to flash floods. In part of #Stroud cars were underwater. @EnvAgency says 11 flood warnings remain in place for the county today.

(Picture Credit: Adrian Teal) https://t.co/pTfshk74OS

A major milestone has been achieved - Mytholmroyd's new flood defences are ready for winter to better protect 400 homes & businesses.

Thank you to the local community for their patience during the construction of this important & complex ¬£41m scheme.

https://t.co/RBitmIFTRX https://t.co/ygj1bskYIv
Whatever your circumstances I wish you the best Christmas possible and a big shout out to all the @APHAgovuk and @EnvAgency staff dealing with Bird Flu and Flooding over the festive period

One of several small stage zero #RiverRestoration projects in Swindale looking good today with a bit of water. We breached a section of bank on a perched artifical channel to reconnect the flow with its natural floodplain.
